result.execSummary:
The defendant Gerald L. Gordon IV was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by agent.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.  Obtain GED or H.S.E.D. during term of probation.
*   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*   Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay the surcharge, notice given to def. in court.
May not associate with gangs/gang members or gang affiliations.  May not have contact with Carl Vines or Antonio Mace or Thomas Scott, unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.  No ammunition shall be possssed.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Gerald L. Gordon IV

records.addlTxt:
State appears by Attorney Alexandra Smathers. Attorney Aileen Henry in court with Defendant Gerald L. Gordon who appears in custody.  Clerk: PU
  Case is resolved and DE waives any conflict with proceeding before Judge Gabriele today.  DE pleads Guilty; found guilty by the Court.    Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay the surcharge, notice given to DE in court.   Sentencing arguments made.  Sentence is withheld and DE is placed on probation for 2 years with conditions. As a condition court imposes 120 days in the KCJ forthwith.  Credit for 85 days.  Any unpaid financial obligations that remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
Court is no longer available in the AM on 7/13/22 so hearing moved to 1:40 PM on 7/13/22 and confirmed with Atty Henry
No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.

PROPER ATTIRE REQUIRED.  NO SHORTS OR TANK TOPS ALLOWED IN COURTROOM.
 No Weapons expecially firearms,  No contact including the residence, electronic or 3rd party with:  Carl V, Antonio M, Thomas S

200PM  State appeared by Attorney Drew Lehman.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Francesco Balistrieri.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  The Court finds probable cause in this case today.  Plea of Not Guilty entered.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 10, 2022 at 01:40 pm.  Final pre-trial scheduled for July 13, 2022 at 09:40 am.  Jury selection scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 09:00 am.  $10,000  Cash Bond Set w/conditions (see bond entry).  kmk
and witness list filed by the State
